author: 8BrickMario
title: Does the job.
review:
I'd been eyeing one of these storage heads for a long time as a place to put my minifigure collection, which was otherwise taking up space in bins that could have better gone to parts storage, so I decided to pick one up.

The nice things about the box are that it's a giant minifigure head and is pretty spacious inside. The lid is hollow as well, allowing the contents to pile up a bit inside. If you own multiple of these heads, their studs allow them to stack as well.

There are two things I don't like about the design. The choice of the modern equivalent to the classic smiley makes sense but doesn't work for me. The face isn't very appealing as a giant disembodied head and doesn't have the charm of the old face. I blacked out the white dots and rubbed off the eyebrows to get it pretty close to the classic look so I would enjoy looking at the box more. The other flaw with the box is that its lid fits nicely, but I really would have preferred some kind of screw cap or twist-lock feature to ensure the lid stayed on tight. The shape of the box is highly unlikely to tip over, but if it was knocked off a table or shelf, there's a big spill waiting.

This isn't a set and there's not much to say about it. It's a cute design and offers good storage, but falls a bit short of maximum practicality and appeal. I might get the large skull for my minifigure parts and the small pumpkin for whatever else, though. They're pretty neat pieces.
